Posts.Content: Katie The manuka 15 honey only £10 in Tesco, I have priced around :-) Lisa
Posts.Title: Starting chemo in 11 days.....

Posts.Content: Hi I started to notice my hair falling out on Saturday ( day 11 after 1st FEC ) by Monday night I it was coming out in handfuls at the front, so went last night and had it all shaved off.  I have found it great getting it all off rather than watching it coming out in handfuls. I got a wig but really don't like the feel of it on and I have always had very fine hair and the wig just isn't me. So today I wore an elasticated scarf. Was quite a day, going into work, out for lunch, corner shop and Tesco. Meeting people who didn't know I had cancer was awkward.  But am quite proud of myself , I think if I hadn't of went out I maybe never would! Came home to find my new hair piece delivered.  It is a hair band with hair all the way around it.  It needs styled by hairdresser and I might add a few blond highlights, but am so pleased with it.  Will be so handy under a baseball cap or beanie.   I got it free from Heathers Hair (google it). Tonight I am sitting watching tv with bh and kids with no scarf or wig, and we are all happy with it.  Life is good x
Posts.Title: hair starting to go :-(

Posts.Content: I have spent most of my adult life ashamed of my breasts (32aa) so was quite shocked when I was diagnosed, how could this little thing even find room for cancer lol My lumpectomy was on my clevage, not that I had a clevage without the wonder bras!  I went on holidays last week, and for the 1st time had to show myself in public with 1 padded cup full and 1 padded cup empty. I can honestly say I never saw anyone noticing.  Everyone comes in all shapes and sizes!   Every night before I go to bed, I ask my bh, well what do you think of boob tonight, it lets him and me get used to looking at all the changes.  My 2 teenage kids have also seen the changes and are quite happy, they do still call me "titty smurf" with all the blue dye. So, I ramble lol But what I am trying to say is, never feel ashamed, look how brave you have been and how far you have come, your children are enjoying the time with you, you should be one proud mamma..
Posts.Title: Ashamed/Embarrassed by scar.......

Posts.Content: Hi Up until I had my operations I always had gel nails and sometimes extensions. I am starting chemo on Tuesday, can I get my gel nails or extensions on? I know its quite vain, but want something girlie for when I loose my hair Thanks
Posts.Title: Gel nails - chemo?

Posts.Content: Hi Tracey Having 3 fec then 3 fect, so is that a yes?
Posts.Title: Gel nails - chemo?

Posts.Content: Thanks everyone for the tips, not sure if chemo going ahead on Tuesday, after 5 weeks the wound under my arm has decided to play up and has an infection.  I am gutted!!  I am panicing about this being delayed as I am grade 3.  Won't know until Tuesday until I see doctor, keep everything crossed for me x
Posts.Title: Shopping list for chemo - am I missing anything?

Posts.Content: Hi Starting chemo on Tuesday, I have been reading all your helpful tips and have come up with this list, is there anything else anyone recommends Pineapple Manuka honey Plastic knives and forks Lots of ginger biscuits Ginger tea Dark nail polish Waterproof mascara Mashmallows/ liqorice anti sickness bands mouthwash toothbrush thanks
Posts.Title: Shopping list for chemo - am I missing anything?

Posts.Content: thanks, I'm adding as I go along and then will print off lol
Posts.Title: Shopping list for chemo - am I missing anything?

Posts.Content: Thanks everyone for the tips, not sure if chemo going ahead on Tuesday, after 5 weeks the wound under my arm has decided to play up and has an infection.  I am gutted!!  I am panicing about this being delayed as I am grade 3.  Won't know until Tuesday until I see doctor, keep everything crossed for me x
Posts.Title: Shopping list for chemo - am I missing anything?

Posts.Content: Thanks Tracey Spent 4 hours on drip, and home with driver in place.  Keeping it in until Monday and then putting it in day before next chemo.  Feeling so much better already.  Came home and had bowl of champ and big glass of milk!  Ist food I,ve been able to keep down.
Posts.Title: Syringe driver for sickness?

Posts.Content: Hi Had my 1st chemo yesterday, have been very sick all night, ran hospital this morning and have to go in to get a driver for sickness.  Does anyone know anything about this? Thanks
Posts.Title: Syringe driver for sickness?

Posts.Content: Hi It's a bit of a shock isn't it!!  I am also grade 3 and nodes where affected.  My oncologist asked me did I want to know the 10 year survival rates for having chemo and not.  This made my mind up for me. I had my 1st chemo 2 1/2 weeks ago and truthfully it wasn't as bad as I thought it would be.  I know its early days but feeling very positive I can do this.   Lisa
Posts.Title: Help - Results today

Posts.Content: Hi I was very sick after 1st chemo and they gave me a syringe driver which gives you the anti sickness drugs 24 hours a day.  This was like a miracle, I haven't been sick since.  They are giving it to me again before my next chemo so I won't have to face the sickness again.  Always ask for help from the nurses they will sort you out. Lisa
Posts.Title: Help - Results today

Posts.Content: Hi I've been told I will have lump removed and sentinel node in 4 wks I have holidays booked for 8 weeks time, will it be possible to go? and has anyone any tips on getting travel insurance.  I am heading to spain, hate having to tell kids there will be no holiday thanks Lisa
Posts.Title: holidays after getting lump removed but before treatment?

Posts.Content: Hi Andrea Like you I am new to this too, I was diagnosed 16th May, grad,e 3 Her2+.  I had lumpectomy 9th June and then node removal 30th June.  Chemo starts 12th August so a bit of a different order of treatment. I have 2 kids, daughter 16 and son 14, I didn't tell them for a couple of weeks which was hard, I felt I couldn't look them in the eye, but my daughter was sitting her GCSE's and I was afraid it would upset her.  I was wrong, they have both taken this in their stride and got on with life normally probably because I have too.  I was back at work 4 days after both operations ( my work is in an office and my boss is great friend, so all very easy ) I had family holiday booked for 16th July, from day 1  that was my aim, get operations over and have my 10 days lying beside the pool, doctors himmed and haaaad whether I would be able to go, but I think setting myself a goal helped, was so glad I did it. Have been very positive and got on with my life, only had wee worries randomly, until Tuesday when I heard when chemo started, have to admit, for 1st time I fell apart big time!! It felt like such a long long journey.  Today I have read some posts on here and have got my mojo back, plan to take one chemo at a time, get it over and have a treat, bh has promised me shoes :-) Hope all goes well for you, I have constant tune in my head " I get knocked down but I get up again" working for me  Lisa
Posts.Title: New Person!!!

Posts.Content: Hi Andrea Like you I am new to this too, I was diagnosed 16th May, grad,e 3 Her2+.  I had lumpectomy 9th June and then node removal 30th June.  Chemo starts 12th August so a bit of a different order of treatment. I have 2 kids, daughter 16 and son 14, I didn't tell them for a couple of weeks which was hard, I felt I couldn't look them in the eye, but my daughter was sitting her GCSE's and I was afraid it would upset her.  I was wrong, they have both taken this in their stride and got on with life normally probably because I have too.  I was back at work 4 days after both operations ( my work is in an office and my boss is great friend, so all very easy ) I had family holiday booked for 16th July, from day 1  that was my aim, get operations over and have my 10 days lying beside the pool, doctors himmed and haaaad whether I would be able to go, but I think setting myself a goal helped, was so glad I did it. Have been very positive and got on with my life, only had wee worries randomly, until Tuesday when I heard when chemo started, have to admit, for 1st time I fell apart big time!! It felt like such a long long journey.  Today I have read some posts on here and have got my mojo back, plan to take one chemo at a time, get it over and have a treat, bh has promised me shoes :-) Hope all goes well for you, I have constant tune in my head " I get knocked down but I get up again" working for me  Lisa
Posts.Title: New Person!!!

Posts.Content: Andrea Don't be afraid of surgery, I honestly thought it would be much worse than it was.  My biggest fear was staying in hospital, after lumpectomy which was at 4 pm, I asked for all drugs going and slept most of the night, next morning when doctor, physio and breast nurse saw me, I was allowed to go home, phoned bh who was at work and 20 mins latre went home in my pj's, took paracetemol during day and co codomal at night ( just in case I couldn't sleep).  Most important thing if you are getting nodes removed is to do exercises. Like you, I feel like it's not really happening to me, after 1st couple of days of feeling very sorry for myself, I just got on with life,I went to work, I didn't feel sick, I didn't wake up every morning as someone with cancer, I was annoyed when anyone asked am I ok!  Only way I can describe it is I made a wee bubble around me, maybe didn't really believe it, maybe was in denial, maybe was trying to act normal, but it worked for me, I slept well, I ate too too well, I still went for nights out, i honestly thought this is so easy. I was supposed to get married in October and the 1st time my bh brought up putting off wedding until next year, I through a wobbler!! How dare he burst my bubble lol Took me a couple of days to realise yes he is right, next year we will have such a party, so many people to share our day who have shown us how good a friend they are. After having a "speed wobble" on Tuesday, am now back in my bubble, maybe smaller goals, I have to get over 1st chemo to go with my daughter to get her GCSE results, have to get over 2nd chemo to go with my son to get his braces off.  My bubbles maybe have got smaller but it is still a nice place to be x

Posts.Title: New Person!!!

Posts.Content: Hi Everyone is different, it all depends on what type of work you would be doing.  I had WLE and SNB on the Monday and was able to go into work on the Friday for couple of hours, but and its a BIG but, my boss (who is a good friend) collected me, I wasn't comfortable driving for about 10 days.  I do office based work, so no heavy lifting or standing.  Also I knew, if after an hour I had had enough, that was fine, I would be delivered home again.  It made me feel normal again to get on with life.   I think from past experience you can phone your doctor and ask for sick line if you don't need to see him/her.  Hope all goes well for 20th, it will surprise you how well you will do, just keep up the exercises they give you, they really make a difference. Lisa
Posts.Title: Off work

Posts.Content: Ro  What do you mean about electric and heating reduced? Lisa
Posts.Title: Macmillan benefits advice.

Posts.Content: Hi Joanne, I had lumpectomy and snl removal 2 weeks ago as well, I have to go on Monday to have full node removal :-( I am getting through it by keeping busy, I am back at work and generally getting on with normal life.  Was in shock for a couple of days but am trying to set myself targets, I plan to go on holidays before chemo starts, I was supposed to get married 3rd October, have booked for next year 3rd October and some days when I don't feel so positive, I make myself get dressed and go for coffee with my mates.  I think I am saying set yourself a target no matter how small it is x
Posts.Title: Feel so alone

Posts.Content: Hi Trying to get organised for loosing my hair.  Can anyone recommend a good web site to buy hats and scarves and also which is the best type, I have a fear of scarf falling off lol Lisa
Posts.Title: hats and scarves ?

Posts.Content: thanks everyone, I think a serious bit of retail therapy is on its way x
Posts.Title: hats and scarves ?

Posts.Content: it is nice hearing all your advice, I start chemo next Tuesday, I really wish there was a "like" button on this site like facebook, I would be clicking it all day Lisa
Posts.Title: I am a Newby......and potential guinea pig!!!!!!!
